Why Deceive Ourselves?

A dimly lit tavern, laughter echoes.  
Svidrigaïlov smirks, eyes gleaming.  
Svidrigaïlov: "Everyone deceives himself, ha-ha!"  

---

A dance hall, shadows swirl.  
A young girl dances, visibly distressed.  
Svidrigaïlov: "I love children, very fond!"  
Svidrigaïlov: "Look at her... so innocent."

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Svidrigaïlov reflects on human nature, self-deception, and the moral decay he observes in society.
